content.description: Super fun climbing on great rock. Climb first 5 bolts of Monkey Wrench Gang, which is the third bolted route from right side of wall. Clip that 5th bolt with an extended alpine draw if you have it, then step up and left toward nice looking headwall up and left. You will briefly step left and down to ledge, then clip another bolt as you make your way up the arete above you. Continue on bolts up rounded arete on great jugs and pockets. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: The third bolted line from right side of Kitty wall is MWG, start on that, then head left and up toward headwall along arete.

content.description: Interesting start at steep seem over bulge to overhung face moves on nice crimps and pockets. Short but nice.
content.location: Just to right of trad line For some reason, as prow at right side of kitty pool meets opening to atlantis

content.description: I really do think this is worth 4 stars, the finish is so sick! The climb begins as the first 4 bolts of "Or another", then continues on 5 more bolts toward fantastic sculpted roof above and right. The top portion of this line is exposed but the steep finish is super juggy and the move well protected.
content.location: First bolted route on right side of wall, just to left of a couple roofs and crack system. You'll climb first 4 bolts of "Or another", clip that 4th bolt with an extended alpine draw, then continue up and right toward arete (careful of yucca - they will be trimmed) below the wave (roof), clipping more bolts, pulling the final steep wall on jugs. Much easier than it looks from the bottom. Scramble to the top and do the obligatory "Riding the wave" photo!

content.description: A Time-Honored Tradition observes a mariner's transformation from slimy Pollywog, a seaman who hasn't crossed the equator, to trusty Shellback, also called a Son or Daughter of Neptune. It was a way for sailors to be tested for their seaworthiness. A great route for new leaders testing their "seaworthiness".
content.location: Make your way up the Kitty pool gully all the way to the top of it. Take caution with some of the loose rock on the way up.

content.description: Fun route. Good movements. Well protected.
content.protection: 5 bolt face to a 2 bolt anchor w/chains
content.location: Very first wall you get to as you're hiking into the canyon, it is climbers left of the route "For some reason"

climbs.name: Monkey Wrench Gang
climbs.fa: Jared Putterman, Scott Duemler, Michael Genovese

content.description: Fun climbing up good rock past some sloping holds, atypical climbing style for qc sport.
content.location: Up dirty talus from start of gonzo bacon about 15 feet is start of mwg just left of left facing corner with crack. Clean rock.

content.description: Fun and technical moving through a short dihedral. Continue over a short bulge on amazing jugs. 20 feet of Easy runout 5.5ish on top - bring a .75 or #1 BD in horizontal crack for that if desired.
content.location: Toward top of kitty pool gully on right side, just around corner from top half of water wings. Look for large ledge with catclaw tree on it's left side. There's a single belay bolt on the right side of the ledge.

content.description: Good pro, new route but will clean up well with more ascents. Great option for first trad lead - has very frequent pro and options for either jams or face features.
content.protection: To have options you could bring BD .75 x 1, #1 x 2, #2 x 2, #3 x 1. Two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Short crack just right of Pollywog.

content.description: Clean rock over face then through short finger crack. Shares last bolt with "Or another".  Because everything is better with bacon!
content.protection: 5 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Shares last bolt and anchor with "Or another".
content.location: Just left of "Or another" on left side flank as you enter Atlantis proper.

content.description: Hand crack through a roof/corner past a bulgy section to two bolt anchor
content.location: As you enter from the west, it's the first crack system on your left before entering the creek bed.

content.description: Clip first bolt on easy arete to ledge. Do your best Chicken Star Rocket to get over bulge crux and continue on face.
content.location: Around corner to left of Arete already on left side of Kitty Pool area.

content.description: Over a series of bulges, steep and consistent for the grade. Route will clean up with more ascents
content.location: On left side of Kitty Pool gully is a rock outcropping. This route goes up prow/arete on end. Well bolted through a multitude of good hands and feet which can sometimes be thought provoking.

content.description: Moderate sport routes, well bolted on great rock.
